item.title: AnTerra Group Has Moved
item.author: Tracee Terranova
item.description:
For those of you who might not know, AnTerra Group’s main office had moved and is now located at 23986 Aliso Creek Rd, Laguna Niguel, CA 92677.

Phone and fax numbers are still the same.

item.title: Harvest Equipment Cleaning
item.author: Tracee Terranova
item.description: AnTerra has developed a new harvesting/transportation equipment cleaning product line called the Harvest Max Series. Call us for details.

item.title: Contract Cleaning Services
item.author: Tracee Terranova
item.description: In September of 2018 AnTerra Group initiated our new Contract Cleaning Services for all of your vegetable, meat and beverage facilities. Contact us for details.

item.title: Tomato Evaporator Cleaning
item.author: Tracee Terranova
item.description: AnTerra develops unique cleaning process for tomato evaporators. Process reduces cleaning times, costs and virtually eliminates cleaning failures.

item.title: Organic Authorized Chemical Peel Aid
item.author: Tracee Terranova
item.description: AnTerra developes a new unique organic chemical peel additive for tomato processing called Nature Peel. Call for information.

item.title: AnTerra Maintains Exclusive Ownerhip of Genesis AC02 Patent
item.author: Tracee Terranova
item.description:
AnTerra Group is pleased to announce that it has successfully resolved pending litigation in federal court in Orange County, which confirms AnTerra’s exclusive ownership of its U.S. Patent Number 8,420,143.

AnTerra’s patent, which issued in 2013, gives AnTerra all exclusive rights to license and use its innovative Genesis AC02 Organic Produce Wash System. The Genesis System utilizes carbon dioxide to optimize chlorine in fruit and vegetable wash systems, replacing conventional food grade acids such as citric acid with carbon dioxide, a safer, greener, and less costly approach to controlling pH in chlorine or surfactant based wash systems. The Genesis AC02 system has also shown improved microbiological control over conventional chlorine-based treatment systems.

item.title: Life Time Member of CCOF
item.author: Tracee Terranova
item.description: Did you know that AnTerra Group, Inc. is a life time member of the California Certified Organic Farmers!

item.title: OMRI Approves Genesis AC02
item.author: Tracee Terranova
item.description: AnTerra Group is pleased to announce that our new patent-pending pH control system “GENESIS AC02” has been approved to be used in certified organic production or food processing and handling according to the USDA National Organic Program Rule.

item.title: Genesis ACO2 Patent Issues
item.author: Tracee Terranova
item.description:
On April 16th, 2013, AnTerra Group, Inc. was issued Patent No# 8420143 for Genesis ACO2 , Organic Produce Wash System.

Congratulations to AnTerra Group on their development of a novel process method designed to utilize carbon dioxide to optimize chlorine in fruit and vegetable wash systems. The Genesis ACO2 System replaces conventional food grade acids such as citric with CO2 a safter, greener and less costly approach to control pH in chlorine or surfactant based wash systems.

Read more about the Genesis CO2 system
